author: steve carlos kirk
comment: Unreliable, they've sent me six hubs over three years. The devices drop off every six or seven months - not battery issues - rather antenna failures. This thing has had complete failures RIGHT BEFORE I've left town three times now - like for month stretches. Stay away. I work in security and surveillance as well as integration. I get it. It sucks.

author: Jaron Fortenberry
comment: Been using this system for 2 years now. app works as it should

author: Andrew Baker
comment: Been 3 years now. I gave it a good chance. Not going to be renewing my subscription. Very buggy system, unreliable, false alarms, logs me out constantly, keyfobs are squirrelly, EATS batteries (and free batteries are not the answer) re-pairing motion detector is a chore when it goes awry. The list goes on. Just can't recommend this system.

Bought new Android with lollipop o\s, no more tone or popup text informing me system Is armed as it did with iphone. Even that took some time with Scout support to correct. Apparently Android and Apple don,t perform the same way with this app.

author: Matt C
comment: The new app looks great with its cleaner interface. I haven't had any issues with the app in a long time. I even recently setup Alexa with it. It works really well with Alexa. Very pleased.

author: Glynn Stiles
comment: The new version isn't working well with the S8 phone.  The previous version was much better. Constant issues with arming and disarming the systemusing the app

author: Chris Kasch
comment: DOES NOT WORK GOOD WITH ANDROID WORKS GOOD ON APPLE

author: Hot Puke
comment: Excellent investment

author: Jason Valleley
comment: It's getting better...I was so excited for a UI refresh, but this is just terrible! It doesn't​follow any of Android's standards, and it's still a hassle to use

author: Komadori Photography
comment: Really disappointed that the latest update wants sooooo many more privileges than it used to. Why dies an alarm app need my contacts and photos/media and device information and microphone. Would be nice if they were transparent and explained why they needed this info. Other than to sell for profit

reply.author: Scout Security Inc.
reply.content: Hi Robin, The latest release asks to access your contacts in order to auto-complete email addresses when adding new members. The photos, media and microphone permissions are used by Instabug so you can include screenshots or media when sending feedback. If you are on Android 6 or later, you can use the app without allowing them.

author: Jason Corbin
comment: Has potential. Overpromises. My system was offline for an entire week with false notifications from Scout telling me all was well! Unreliable. I returned everything.

author: Victorian Man
comment: please say to me verify code.....emergency.....

author: Reginald Brown
comment: I recently set up an alarm with 13 sensors, a hub, and a door panel, with one more sensor on the way (and maybe another couple after that). There were a couple hiccups during setup, but the support team is extremely helpful. If you have inlaid door frames, contact support and they will send you free magnets that work with said door frames.   The app itself works great, the widgets are awesome, the notifications work if the alarm is tripped. IFTTT and/or some Tasker and AutiInput integration, and you can really do some cool stuff. I am definitely happy with the purchase.   One downside: OK Google input doesn't work on my Nexus 6. It just performs a Google search for the command.

author: Jeremiah Casey
comment: Never had a problem with the app. The devices are easy to set up so long as you read the instructions (I had a lot of problems before I did that). Can't beat the price and convenience. Had the alarm for about a year now . I bought some rechargeable batteries from China . I change them about 4 times a year .
title: Works

author: Michael Wilkey
comment: Went to install over 500 in product. Base Station, door sensor, 2 motion sensors, 7 window sensors. All had dead batteries. They see my new batteries as "low" and will only connect when within inches of base hub. When installed they won't update at all, even though they are 20 feet away within eyesight of the hub. And no way I'm signing up for a forced service when they don't even work.  And app constantly crashes on top of everything.
title: Products Don't Work. App crashes. Forced sign up

author: James Reeves
comment: No problems with it. Works great
title: Works as advertised

author: Eric
comment: Like the widgets. Hardware needs some improvements. Additional Hardware offerings (glass break., etc.) and integrations would be bice. Integration with Nest, IFTTT, DO, LIFX etc are great.
title: Great app. Good Company. Work in Progress, Slowly

author: David Fuchs
comment: Are you kidding, scout? Nothing works after the update to their fancy new platform. App does literally *nothing* other than show random error messages and occasionally crash. UPDATE: wiping app data solved the issue. Not exactly what I call a smooth rollout.

author: Dave Schneider
comment: The app uodated last night. it auto armed the alarm, when the alarm triggered this morning i could not turn it off or control it. Turned my securtiy system into junk. It also claimed there was smoke in my house at 12am. Yet nest doesnt show it. Fails all around by scout. Took me weeks to get my product, mins to install, hopefully the return process is easy. this company really cant keep it together.
title: Updated app lost control to alarm

author: Jon Keto
comment: Looks like app service was updated and not backwards compatible meaning if alarm is going off I have to update app in order to turn it off. Amateur hour.
title: For latest update process

author: Timothy Meyers
comment: Forced to install the new version....now it makes me re-login into the app every morning when I wake up.....what gives?

author: Christopher Maler
comment: Sometimes doesn't show changes for minutes. Doesn't update alarm state properly. Shows alarm in test mode almost all the time
title: Slow to respond to changes

author: Ryan M
comment: I had a few issues early on, but support was great and there haven't been any issues for months.  It's dully integrated with IFTTT, Nest, Hue, and Echo.  Totally rocks.
title: Works great

author: Steve Reese
comment: I love my system and all of the easy integrations. This and ifttt is a must for any iot enthusiast!
title: Great app and diy security system

author: Nancy Milligan
comment: This app crashes sometimes, but for the most part it works well. I do wish you had the option of not being prompted for the nest camera. For instance it would be nice if they just turn the camera on without the prompt.
title: Pretty good

author: Hemendra Gupte
comment: The app works with no issues. Just have a minor defect of not able to update the timezone. Even though I change it, it reverts back to central time zone.
title: Works perfectly

author: Jason Silva
comment: Battery life on all sensors is terrible, be ready to replace batteries every 1 to 2 months. I wish it would go into home automation like smart things. Also, please add a password verification before arming and unarming. I also wish there was a presence fob.
title: Awesome

author: Big Ceez
comment: Stopped working completely sux just a waste!
title: Doesn't even work

author: Mike DeGeus
comment: I want to like Scout so badly... But it seems that whole system 90% works and is 10% really frustrating. That holds true for the app. Nice interface that mostly does what I need it to, but so buggy. I'm constantly exiting the app and going back in to get it to refresh. When editing an alarm mode the only way to save it is by clicking in the title area. Other little glitches like this make it frustrating rather than elegant to use. UPDATE: dev fixed bug  that forced me to constantly exit app. Thank you!
title: Want to love it

author: Chris Cunningham
comment: Looks nice, decent design, but badly needs a refresh button because the app is often out of sync with the system. Often we disarm with the fob and minutes pass with the app still claiming we are armed and no mention of the fob use.
title: Pretty, smooth, but often slow to sync

author: Bret Halbe
comment: Doesn't always update with correct alarm status. It would be nice if there was a "refresh", or "sync" button, since alarm status and monitor notifications do not always update. Often I need to log out and then back in in order for the app to show me the current alarm status.

author: Kenton Roberts
comment: Sometimes I'll arm the home with the watch and fine it didn't actually arm at all. If they handle this problem (also affects the widget though less often) then I'll be happy
title: Wear app flaky

author: Ryan Carter
comment: New update has made this app almost unusable. Takes more than 3 minutes to arm my alarm, and the lock button icons show the alarm as 75% armed. This causes the app to be non responsive and pressing the lock buttons does nothing when it's hung up. I usually have to check online to see if it actually armed or not because I don't trust the app.
title: Was great before the most recent update

author: Jack Deslippe
comment: New user here. So far this works great. Nice UI. Like integration with NEST. I came from iSmartAlarm which was horrible. Scout is a breath of fresh air in comparison.

author: Ron Clardy
comment: Got my system, downloaded the Android App, and thus far it has crashed every time while just trying to register the system. Haven't even gotten to actually installing it.        Update 5/28. It was Memorial Day weekend, so I wasn't expecting an immediate response.  Got one Tuesday, and the app was updated  and fixed the issue.  Only complaint is the Activity Log doesn't update real quick. Even pulling the page down to force an update doesn't get new records. Lags a bit.
title: Not off to a good start

author: Esteban Torres
comment: Well done! This app is getting better and better keep it up!
title: Works well

author: David Fuchs
comment: App logs me out every week or two for no reason at all.  This is pretty basic functionality, and hasn't been working correctly since the first version. Contacted support multiple times about this issue, they won't fix.

author: David Yarnevich
comment: Fantastic system. Does exactly what I wanted it to, easy setup. No commitment on monitoring, but it's an option if you want it.

author: Melissa Craig
comment: Very buggy and siren will not work on my phone. Always changing batteries and resetting notification alerts.
Frequently get logged out of the app for no reason.
